required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Offering Free Fruits and Vegetables to Men at Risk of Poverty
clinical_study.official_title: Studie Zum Einfluss Der Bereitstellung Von Kostenlosem Favorisiertem Obst Und Gemüse Auf Das Ernährungsverhalten

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate whether the provision of free fresh fruits and vegetables to middle-aged men at risk of poverty increases their fruit and vegetable intake over a period of 4 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
A total of 100 men (> 30 years, living alone) with a low SES will be randomly assigned to a control or intervention group while controlling for food bank use. The intervention group will receive free fresh fruits and vegetables consisting of 2 daily portions of their favorite variety over a period of 4 weeks which will be provided to them once per week.
All participants will be asked to fill out a demographic questionnaire as well as a Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ), a questionnaire on variety of fruits and vegetables consumed and a 24-h-food-recall questionnaire. All questionnaires will be administered by trained interviewers. During the study period, the 24h-food recall questionnaire will be administered four more times; two times before the 4-week intervention period and two times after the intervention period. After the 4-week intervention period, interviewers will administered the FFQ and the questionnaire on variety.
Participants assigned to the control group will receive a fruit and vegetable basket after 4 weeks after baseline.
All participants will receive gift certificates for local supermarkets in the amount of 35,00 €.

primary_outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable variety consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention.
The difference of fruit and vegetable amount consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variety of Fruits and Vegetables Among Food Bank Users
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable variety consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention among food bank users.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Fruits and Vegetables Among Food Bank Users
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable amount consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention among food bank users.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variety of Fruits and Vegetables Among Non-Food Bank Users
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable variety consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention among non-food bank users.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of Fruits and Vegetables Among Non-Food Bank Users
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable amount consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention among non-food bank users.

arm_group.description: After baseline assessment of food intake patterns, the intervention will consist of providing free fruits and vegetables of their choice for a period of four weeks which will be provided fresh each week. At baseline and at the end of the 4-week period, a FFQ, two 24h-recalls and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable variety will be administered.

At baseline and at the end of the 4-week period, a FFQ, four 24h-recalls and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable variety will be administered. At the end of the intervention period they receive once a basket of free fruits and vegetables.

intervention.description: The intervention consists of providing free fruits and vegetables of the participants' liking for a period of 4 weeks. Each week, a total of 2 portions of either fruits and/or vegetables per day will be provided.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- income below 980 € per month
- > 30 years of age
- living alone
- without regular food delivery service (except for e.g. meals on wheels once a day)
- born in Germany
- speaks German
Exclusion Criteria:
- lives in assisted living accommodations

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Nutritional Medicine, University of Hohenheim

facility.name: Institute of Nutritional Medicine, University of Hohenheim

group.title: Free Fruit and Vegetables
group.description: A total of four 24h-food-recall questionnaires will be administered to men (>30 years, living alone) at risk of poverty over a period of approximately 8 weeks. After baseline assessment of food intake patterns, the intervention will consist of providing free fruits and vegetables of their choice for a period of four weeks which will be provided fresh each week. At baseline and at the end of the 8-week period, a FFQ and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable amounts and variety will be administered. Intervention Group: The intervention consists of providing free fruits and vegetables of the participants' liking for a period of 4 weeks. Each week, a total of 2 portions of either fruits and/or vegetables per day will be provided.

group.title: Control Goup
group.description: Control Group: A total of four 24h-food-recall questionnaires will be administered to men (>30 years, living alone) at risk of poverty over a period of approximately 8 weeks to assess their usual food intake. At baseline and at the end a 4-week period, a FFQ and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable amounts and variety will be administered.

participants_list.participants: n=12 food bank users; n=13 non-food bank users
n=12 food bank users; n=15 non-food bank users

outcome.title: Variety of Fruits and Vegetables
outcome.description: The difference of fruit and vegetable variety consumed between baseline and after the 4-week intervention.

group.title: Intervention Group
group.description: received weekly 14 portions of free fresh fruits and vegetables over a period of four weeks

group.title: Control Group
group.description: did not receive free fresh fruits and vegetables

group.title: Free Fruit and Vegetables
group.description: A total of four 24h-food-recall questionnaires will be administered to men (>30 years, living alone) at risk of poverty over a period of approximately 8 weeks. After baseline assessment of food intake patterns, the intervention will consist of providing free fruits and vegetables of their choice for a period of four weeks which will be provided fresh each week. At baseline and at the end of the 8-week period, a FFQ and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable amounts and variety will be administered. Intervention Group: The intervention consists of providing free fruits and vegetables of the participants' liking for a period of 4 weeks. Each week, a total of 2 portions of either fruits and/or vegetables per day will be provided.

group.title: Control Goup
group.description: Control Group: A total of four 24h-food-recall questionnaires will be administered to men (>30 years, living alone) at risk of poverty over a period of approximately 8 weeks to assess their usual food intake. At baseline and at the end a 4-week period, a FFQ and a questionnaire on consumed fruit and vegetable amounts and variety will be administered.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
